meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unalterable.
meanings.sent1: The unalterability of the ancient ruins amazed the archaeologists.
meanings.sent2: The unalterability of the law made it difficult to amend.
meanings.sent3: The unalterability of the recipe led to a delicious dish every time.
meanings.sent4: Her unalterability in her beliefs was like a rock in the storm of opinions.
meanings.sent5: The unalterability of the mountain range was a testament to time's passage.

meanings.definition: The inability to be changed or modified.
meanings.sent1: The unalterability of the contract meant no alterations could be made.
meanings.sent2: His unalterability in his decision surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: The unalterability of the weather forecast made the meteorologist chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The unalterability of the traffic jam turned a short trip into a long wait.
meanings.sent5: The unalterability of the painting's colors preserved its beauty for centuries.
